alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 11:49AM EDT until July 13 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Housatonic River At Gaylordsville. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The water reaches businesses on the low side of Spring Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:01 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 04/25/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Housatonic River Gaylordsville Flood Stage: 8.0 Observed Stage at Tue 11 am: 9.2 Forecast: Tue 2 pm 9.4 Tue 8 pm 9.1 Wed 2 am 8.8 Wed 8 am 8.5 Wed 2 pm 8.2 Wed 8 pm 7.9 Thu 2 am 7.6 Thu 8 am 7.3 Thu 2 pm 7.1 Thu 8 pm 6.8 Fri 2 am 6.6 Fri 8 am MSG &&
